title: Beet Soup With Indian Spices
summary: Need a gluten free and vegetarian soup? Beet Soup With Indian Spices could be a tremendous recipe to try. This recipe serves 6. One serving contains 38 calories, 1g of protein, and 2g of fat. For 29 cents per serving, this recipe covers 3% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is an inexpensive recipe for fans of Indian food. 1 person found this recipe to be scrumptious and satisfying. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for Autumn. A mixture of onion, cayenne pepper, ground cumin, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 59 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 16%. This score is rather bad. Try Green-Lentil Soup with Coconut Milk and Indian Spices, Salmon With Indian Spices, and Peanuts with Indian Spices for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Gruener Veltliner, Riesling, and Sparkling ros√© are my top picks for Indian. The best wine for Indian food will depending on the dish, of course, but these picks can be served chilled and have some sweetness to complement the spiciness and complex flavors of a wide variety of traditional dishes. One wine you could try is Berger Gruner Veltliner (1 Liter). It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 15 dollars.

productMatches.title: Berger Gruner Veltliner (1 Liter)
productMatches.description: Berger's Gruner Veltliner is the quintessential Summer sipper! This Austrian white grape variety produces a crisp and mineral-focused wine with hints of citrus, lemon peel, lychee, and a touch of spiciness that may remind you of white pepper. Its refreshingly crisp body works great on a warm Summer day, especially when you're outdoors.
